headline.main: JAPAN SENDS SATO AS ENVOY TO SOVIET; One of Leading Diplomats to Succeed Tatekawa, Who Quit Because of 'Ill Health' NO RUSSIAN THREAT SEEN Premier Tojo Says Northern Defenses Are Strong, Giving 'Absolute Security'

lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Feb. 28 (From Japanese Broadcasts Recorded by The United Press in New York) -- Naotaka Sato, one of Japan's most astute diplomats, was named Ambassador to Russia today. The Premier, General Hideki Tojo, warned that Japan's northern defenses were so strong that they provide "absolute security" against any threat from that direction.
abstract: Premier Tojo s to Greater East Asia Construction Council on Jap gains; repts Japan's northern defenses secure from USSR threat; cites Jap mil aims
